intro: Chusua puberula, commonly known as the hairy chusua, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Chusua puberula is often found in moist, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in temperate climates.
